required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Implant Survival in Patients With a Pinnacle Ultamet Device in Conventional Total Hip Joint Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multicentric, Observational Cohort Study for the Evaluation of Implant Survival in Patients With a Metal-on-Metal Pinnacle(R) Ultamet(TM) Device in Conventional Total Hip Joint Replacement.

oversight_info.authority: France: Ministère de l'Enseignement supérieur et de la Recherche

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to evaluate the implant survival rate for patients implanted with a PINNACLE® ULTAMET™ Metal-on-Metal implant for conventional total hip arthroplasty for the treatment of a severe hip disease and true femoral cervical fracture.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: Implant Survival Rate as the duration of PINNACLE® ULTAMET™ implantation for the follow-up duration, free of revision surgery, whatever the cause.

secondary_outcome.description: Measure of hip function using the Harris Hip Score

other_outcome.description: Descriptive analysis of patient serum concentration of Cobalt and Chromium
Descriptive Analysis of Adverse Event Frequency for the duration of the study.

arm_group.description: Patients implanted with a PINNACLE® ULTAMET™ Metal-on-Metal implant for conventional total hip arthroplasty for the treatment of a severe hip disease or true femoral cervical fracture.

study_pop.textblock: Patients susceptible to receive a PINNACLE® ULTAMET™ implant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients susceptible to receive a PINNACLE® ULTAMET™ implant as per routine practice
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal to participate to the data collection
- Pregnant woman
- Patients age is less than 18 years old
- The planned intervention is a revision of a previous intervention on the studied hip joint
- Previous metal implant, except for pure titanium or titanium alloys
- Exposure to cobalt and chromium that could influence serum metal ions levels
- Planned bilateral intervention
- Patient residing outside France
- Patient not implanted with a Pinnacle(R) ULTAMET(TM)

reference.citation: Harris WH. Traumatic arthritis of the hip after dislocation and acetabular fractures: treatment by mold arthroplasty. An end-result study using a new method of result evaluation. J Bone Joint Surg Am. 1969 Jun;51(4):737-55.
